issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

fields.description:
Hi everyone,

Today I have upgraded to Appcelerator Studio from Titanium Studio since it is giving some login issues screen shot is attached..!Screen Shot 2015-07-27 at 5.47.34 PM.png|thumbnail!

While logging into Appcelerator also i am getting loging issue..screen shot is given below for your reference..If anyone found the solutions for these issues please help me out..Thanks in advance..

!Screen Shot 2015-07-27 at 5.50.11 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Appcelerator is not getting logged in
fields.environment:
Appcelator Studio 4.1.0
System : Mac mini 
OS version : OS X Yosemite version 10.10.1
Processor:  2.6 GHz Intel Core i5
Memory : 8 GB 1600 MHz DDR3

comments.body:
Hello,

Please follow these steps to resolve the issue and let us know.

Follow the link below to install Node:

http://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/guide/Installing_Node


Then using CLI try following commands

1. sudo npm install appcelerator -g
2. appc setup

Thanks.

Hello,

First, Try using the latest Appcelerator Studio, build: 4.3.3.201510212245. The error occurs because last tame you try to install CLI it was interrupted somehow. So you need to delete the ".appcelerator" folder in your home directory and try manually installing the CLI. Chech if node is installed correctly by "node --version" command. Now, ran "sudo npm install appcelerator -g" and then "appc setup" in terminal. Follow through the process and reply if any problem arises. Thanks.
